executive_summary: Tom Hayes is extremely bullish on value stocks, particularly those temporarily out of favor. He is bearish on the Magnificent 7, believing their earnings growth is decelerating and they are targets for regulatory action. He highlights opportunities in VF Corp, Alibaba, Disney, PayPal, Stanley Black & Decker, Horel Foods and Crown Castle International. He emphasizes the importance of buying high-quality assets at good prices and sticking to basic principles.

tom_current_conviction.overall_market: Bullish on value, bearish on growth and Mag 7
key_reasons: Earnings growth accelerating in small and mid-cap stocks
Opportunity to buy high-quality assets at discounted prices

macro_thesis_summary: The market is transitioning from a growth-dominated environment to one where value and international stocks will outperform. Tariffs and regulatory pressures will negatively impact the Magnificent 7. Focus should be on companies with strong fundamentals and those benefiting from the manufacturing recovery and global policy shifts.

key_macro_data_points.value: Peaked at 62 cuts last year, now declining
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: This is a positive sign, indicating good things start to happen in the market.
International and US exceptionalism runs in normal cyclical peaks and troughs, and this time will be no different.

key_macro_data_points.value: Expanding for the first time since 2022
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Coming out of a 2-year manufacturing depression in the United States, this is a positive thing.

key_macro_data_points.value: Accelerating in small cap, mid cap, and international stocks
key_macro_data_points.tom_interpretation: Go where the earnings growth is accelerating.
A lot of stuff is going to get bid here, no one's positioned for it, that's going to be an opportunity.

These are the things that we tend to keep an eye on as the carry trade unwinds which means billions upon billions of free Yen that has been parked in mag 7 is coming out this is the story not deep seek it's the carry trade onwi and no one's paying attention to it and when you try to talk about it no one wants to hear about it so I don't talk about it but I just benefit from it

VF Corp.thesis_summary: VF Corp is a turnaround opportunity with brands like Vans and North Face. Solvency risk is off the table, and the company is poised to benefit from a turnaround in Asia. Bracken Darrell is an incredible leader who will run this thing back up to new highs.
key_metrics: Supreme brand sale for $1.5 billion to pay off debt
Sequential improvement in Vans, starting in Europe and Asia
North Face benefiting from turnaround in Asia
VF Corp.price_target_or_valuation: Conservative short-term target of $40, with potential for new highs in a few years.

Alibaba.thesis_summary: Alibaba is the Amazon of China and an AI ETF, providing compute power and cloud services to AI startups in exchange for equity. It is undervalued, trading at a low multiple with significant cash reserves. Their AI model is faster than OpenAI and DeepSeek.
key_metrics: Number one cloud provider in China
Number one retailer to the middle class
AI model faster than OpenAI and DeepSeek
Trading at 5-6-7 times earnings with $70-80 billion in cash
Alibaba.price_target_or_valuation: Historic normalized multiple is like 25 to 30 times
Alibaba.action: Buy if it dips to the mid 90s

Disney.thesis_summary: Disney is a high-quality asset temporarily out of favor, with a durable business model and recurring cycles. Free cash flow is recovering, and the stock price will continue to climb. Social Services will come to your house and they remove the children from the house and they say that you are not a fit parent you're abusing your child by not bringing them to Disney.
key_metrics: Cash flow temporarily impaired due to streaming investment
Disney.price_target_or_valuation: Double from much lower levels in two years.

PayPal.thesis_summary: PayPal is a turnaround story with a sandbagging CEO, Alex Chriss, who is setting low expectations to crush them. The company is generating significant free cash flow and buying back shares.
key_metrics: Non-GAAP EPS of $4.65 in 2024, 21% better than promised
Free cash flow of $6.6 billion in 2024, 32% better than promised
Share repurchases of $6 billion in 2024, 20% more than promised
Guiding for non-GAAP EPS of $4.95-$5.10 in 2025
PayPal.price_target_or_valuation: EPS could land north of $6, free cash flow around $8 billion, and buybacks reaching $7.2 billion in 2025.

Stanley Black & Decker.thesis_summary: Stanley Black & Decker is a generational buy opportunity with a durable moat. Concerns about tariffs are unfounded.
key_metrics: Fear down to 39 on the fear and greed index

risks_and_contrarian_flags: Potential for a weaker jobs report
technical_takeaways: February is historically a weak month. Expect volatility, particularly in the Magnificent 7. The market is broadening, with small and mid-cap stocks outperforming. Bond yields are compressing, and the Japanese Yen is strengthening.
